legal_basis: Notice is given under section 1 of the Statistics of Trade Act 1947.
title: Business Register and Employment Survey 2024

title.text: You are completing this for {ru_name} {trad_as}

description.text: If the company details or structure have changed contact us on {telephone_number_link} or email {email_link}

list: You have been selected to complete the Business Register and Employment Survey (BRES).
Data should relate to all sites in England, Scotland and Wales unless otherwise stated.
We will treat your data securely and confidentially.
You cannot appeal your selection. Your business was selected to give us a comprehensive view of the UK economy.
You still need to complete this survey even if it does not seem relevant. All returns are important as it helps us produce better statistics.
You can provide informed estimates if actual figures are not available.
You can save or print a copy of your answers for your records at the end of this survey.

contents.description: View more information about this survey (this link opens in a new tab)
This survey has the following sections:
In this section you will be asked to check and provide information on the structure of your business.
This includes:

list: the name and address of your business
the operational status of your business
VAT details
employer's PAYE references
additional references not already captured
directors or working owners not paid via PAYE
number of sites in Great Britain
number of employees

contents.description: In this section you will be presented with your business's existing sites. You will be asked to check the information for any errors and provide details of any changes.
This includes:

list: the name, address and postcode of the site
the operational status of the site
number of full-time and part-time employees of the site
the business activity of the site

contents.description: In this section you will be asked to provide details of any additional sites.
This includes:

list: business name and trading style
address and postcode of the additional site
when the additional site started trading
the main business activity of the site
number of full-time and part-time employees

The information you supply is the only information used by the Office for National Statistics (ONS) to update its Inter Departmental Business Register (IDBR) at workplace level with location, employment and Standard Industrial Classification details.
ONS uses the IDBR to design statistical surveys required to produce UK National Accounts.

Your information contributes to local and national employment statistics (this link opens in a new tab), which are used in policy making, strategic planning and monitoring of employment trends by government departments and local authorities.
The information also feeds into a number of key measures of the UK economy.
View the latest publication produced from this survey (this link opens in a new tab).

blocks.page_title: Business structure

contents.description:
In this section you will be asked to check and provide information on the structure of your business.

This includes:

list: the name and address of your business
the operational status of your business
VAT details
employer's PAYE references
additional references not already captured
number of directors or working owners not paid via PAYE
number of sites in Great Britain
number of employees

title.text: We currently hold your business name as {ru_name} {trad_as}. Is this correct?

description:
If you have a trading style or a name the business trades under registered with us, this will appear in brackets after your business name.

The business name specified may not be your business’s legal name if you have previously agreed a reporting structure with ONS.

options.label: Yes, the business name is correct
options.value: Yes, the business name is correct

options.label: No, the business name is not correct
options.value: No, the business name is not correct

blocks.page_title: Correct name for your business

in: Yes, the business name is correct

question.title: What is the correct name of your business?

description.text:
Business name we currently hold:

{ru_name}

If you have a trading style or a name the business trades under, include this in brackets after your business name.

blocks.page_title: Changes to business name

title.text: We currently hold this business's address as {address}. Is this correct?

options.label: Yes, the business address is correct
options.value: Yes, the business address is correct

options.label: No, the business address is not correct
options.value: No, the business address is not correct

blocks.page_title: Correct address for your business

in: Yes, the business address is correct

question.title: What is the correct address for your business?

contents.description: Include the property number, where applicable.

blocks.page_title: Changes to address for your business

title.text: On {ref_p_start_date}, which category best described the operational status of your business?

description: If your business is seasonal, treat as if it is active.

options.label: The business was active with all or part of the activity taking place within Great Britain (GB)
options.value: The business was active with all or part of the activity taking place within Great Britain (GB)
options.description: Great Britain consists of England, Scotland and Wales

options.label: The business was active with all of the activity taking place outside GB
options.value: The business was active with all of the activity taking place outside GB

options.label: The business was part of another GB business due to a takeover or merger
options.value: The business was part of another GB business due to a takeover or merger

options.label: The business had not started operating yet
options.value: The business had not started operating yet

options.label: The business had ceased operating but is expecting to restart within two years
options.value: The business had ceased operating but is expecting to restart within two years

options.label: The business had ceased operating and is not expecting to restart within two years
options.value: The business had ceased operating and is not expecting to restart within two years

options.label: The business had never started operating and is not expecting to start
options.value: The business had never started operating and is not expecting to start

blocks.page_title: Operational status of your business

in: The business was active with all or part of the activity taking place within Great Britain (GB)

title.text: On {ref_p_start_date}, was the following VAT registration number and subsidiary reference number correct for your business?

description.text:
If the business was part of a VAT group, any number given will include a three digit subsidiary reference number as part of the overall VAT number.

One or both of these may appear blank.

VAT registration number: {vat_registrationnumber}

Subsidiary reference number: {vat_subsidiaryidentifier}

options.label: Yes, these numbers are correct
options.value: Yes, these numbers are correct

options.label: No, these numbers are not correct
options.value: No, these numbers are not correct

options.label: The business was exempt from VAT
options.value: The business was exempt from VAT

blocks.page_title: Correct VAT registration number and subsidiary reference number of your business

in: No, these numbers are not correct

title.text: On {ref_p_start_date}, what was the correct VAT registration number and subsidiary reference number for your business?

answers.label: VAT registration number
answers.description: This is 9 numbers, sometimes with 'GB' at the start and can be found on your VAT registration certificate. Only enter the 9 numbers

answers.label: Subsidiary reference number
answers.description: If your business is part of a VAT group, this is the additional 3 numbers after the VAT registration number. Leave blank if your business is not part of a VAT group

blocks.page_title: Changes to VAT registration number and subsidiary reference number for your business

title.text: On {ref_p_start_date}, was the following tax office number and employer's PAYE reference number correct for your business?

description.text:
This consists of a tax office number followed by an employer's PAYE reference number, which can be found on your paying-in book and form P35.

One or both of these may appear blank.

Tax office number: {employerpaye_taxofficenumber}

Employer's PAYE reference number: {employerpaye_reference}

options.label: Yes, these numbers are correct
options.value: Yes, these numbers are correct

options.label: No, these numbers are not correct
options.value: No, these numbers are not correct

blocks.page_title: Correct tax office number and employer's PAYE reference number for your business

in: No, these numbers are not correct

title.text: On {ref_p_start_date}, what was the correct tax office number and employer's PAYE reference number for your business?

description: This consists of a tax office number followed by an employer's PAYE reference number, which can be found on your paying-in book and form P35.

blocks.page_title: Changes to tax office number and PAYE reference number for your business

question.title: Provide any additional VAT or employer PAYE reference numbers that your business currently has

answers.label: Additional VAT or employer PAYE reference numbers

blocks.page_title: Additional VAT or employer PAYE reference numbers for your business

title.text: On {ref_p_start_date}, how many directors or working owners were there at your business, who were not paid via PAYE but received drawings or a share of profits?

contents.description: Include:

list: sole traders
sole proprietors
partners
directors

answers.label: Number of directors or working owners not paid via PAYE but received drawings or a share of profits

blocks.page_title: Number of directors or working owners not paid via PAYE but received drawings or a share of profits at your business

title.text: On {ref_p_start_date}, how many sites in Great Britain did your business operate from?

description:
Provide figures for business activity within Great Britain only. Exclude Northern Ireland.

Great Britain consists of England, Scotland and Wales.

contents.description: This refers to sites where one or more persons carried out economic activity for a minimum of 20 hours per week and the planned activity for your business was for more than one year.
Examples of sites include:

list: workshops
factories
warehouses
offices
mines
depots
construction sites

blocks.page_title: Total number of sites in Great Britain your business operated from

title.text: On {ref_p_start_date}, what was your business's total number of employees?

description: This figure should be total head count working on the specified date rather than job roles to avoid double counting employees.

contents.description: Include:

list: full-time, over 30 hours a week, and part-time, 30 hours or less, employees aged 16 years and over. This includes all workers, both permanent and agency workers, individuals working from home and those temporarily absent but still employed, for example those on parental leave or sick leave
agency workers paid direct from the agency payroll
employees at sites where the planned activity was for less than one year
employees at sites staffed for less than 20 hours per week
North Sea Oil Workers and any other employees working on the UK Continental Shelf (UKCS). The UKCS is the region of waters surrounding the United Kingdom in which the country claims mineral rights

contents.description: Exclude:

list: directors and working owners not paid via PAYE
voluntary employees
former employees only receiving a pension

contents.description: An employee is anyone aged 16 years or over who was working directly for the business. They may have been paid direct from the business, from elsewhere within the wider group, or by an external payroll provider on behalf of the company. If your business uses a central payroll to pay employees who work within the wider group, only include employees who worked directly for the business.

blocks.page_title: Business's total number of employees

question.title: Provide any additional comments regarding changes to your business’s operational status
description:
If your business has been taken over or merged with another UK business, provide us with the contact details of the business that should now complete this survey.

It is important that you supply supporting information regarding any business status or structure changes.

blocks.page_title: Comments on operational status

in: The business was active with all or part of the activity taking place within Great Britain (GB)

question.title: Provide any additional comments regarding changes to your business’s operational status, not included in the previous questions
description: If your business has been taken over or merged with another UK business, provide us with the contact details of the business that should now complete this survey.

blocks.page_title: Additional comments on operational status

in: The business was active with all of the activity taking place outside GB
The business was part of another GB business due to a takeover or merger
The business had not started operating yet
The business had ceased operating but is expecting to restart within two years
The business had ceased operating and is not expecting to restart within two years
The business had never started operating and is not expecting to start

blocks.page_title: Existing sites

contents.description: In this section you will be presented with your business's existing sites. You will be asked to check the information for any errors and provide details of any changes.

If you do not have any existing sites, you will be asked to repeat some of the information you have provided in previous questions.

This includes:

list: the name, address and postcode of the site
the operational status of the site
number of full-time and part-time employees of the site
the business activity of the site

title.text: On {ref_p_start_date}, was this site staffed for a minimum of 20 hours per week or had planned activity for more than a year?

contents.description:
If you answer no to this question, include any employees associated with this site in the figures you have reported for your main or head site.

You will be able to amend your figures in the business structure section once you have answered this question.

options.label: Yes
options.value: Yes

options.label: No
options.value: No

blocks.page_title: Activity levels for this site

in: Yes

title.text: On {ref_p_start_date}, which category best described the operational status of this site?

options.label: The site was active and operated by this business
options.value: The site was active and operated by this business

options.label: The site had ceased operating but is expecting to restart within two years
options.value: The site had ceased operating but is expecting to restart within two years

options.label: The site had ceased operating and is not expecting to restart within two years

title.text: On {ref_p_start_date}, what was the number of full-time and part-time employees that your business paid from its payroll, for this site?

contents.description: Include:

list: full-time, over 30 hours a week, and part-time, 30 hours or less, employees aged 16 years and over. This includes individuals working from home and those temporarily absent but still employed, for example those on parental leave or sick leave
agency workers paid direct from the agency payroll
North Sea oil workers and any other employees working on the UK Continental Shelf (UKCS). The UKCS is the region of waters surrounding the United Kingdom in which the country claims mineral rights
home or field workers whose work was organised from this site

contents.description: Exclude:

list: directors and working owners not paid via PAYE
voluntary employees
former employees only receiving a pension

contents.description: An employee is anyone aged 16 years or over who was working directly for the business. They may have been paid direct from the business, from elsewhere within the wider group, or by an external payroll provider on behalf of the company. If your business uses a central payroll to pay employees who work within the wider group, only include employees who worked directly for the business.

answers.label: Number of full-time employees
answers.description: This refers to employees working more than 30 hours per week

answers.label: Number of part-time employees
answers.description: This refers to employees working 30 hours or fewer per week

address and postcode of the additional site
